moves.1. e4: Kings pawn opening. I always do that
moves.1... d5: Scandinavian defence is apparently his favourite
moves.2. Bb5+:
Decided to go for a straight attack.
Not sure why
moves.2... Nc6: c6 or bd7 might have been better
moves.3. Bxc6+ bxc6 4. d3: Defending e4 and letting the bishop free
moves.4... e5 5. Nf3: Develops the knight and attacks e5
moves.5... Bb4+ 6. Nc3 Bxc3+ 7. bxc3 Qe7: Probably did that to defend e5
moves.8. O-O dxe4 9. dxe4: I realized qe7 might have also been to get the queen off the D-file to prevent a queen swap after the pawn trade.
moves.13. Be3: I saw I could skewer him with bc5. I just hoped he wouldn't see it
moves.18... Rxc2 19. Nxd7 Nxd7 20. Rad1 Nf8: Only place the knight could go.
moves.21. Rd3: A2 and c3 were forked by c2 so I protected c3
moves.21... Rxa2 22. Rb1 a5 23. Rd4 a4 24. Rc4: Decided to free the king from the "pawn roof" so if anything bad happened, he wouldn't be stuck under there, getting himself checkmated
moves.30... c6 31. Ra6 c5 32. Rc6 a2 33. Rxc5: He should have gone rb1 because I wouldn't be able to stop a2 promoting.
moves.34. Rd5 Rxd1+: It would have been better to not take my rook because after trading with rxd1 I can capture a2 in a few moves too
moves.35. Rxd1 Ne6 36. Ra1 f5 37. e5: I cant remember why I didn't take f5
He tried to trick me by making me capture f4 enabling him to fork me with ne6
moves.45... Ne6 46. Rg6: Now I can take h6 too
I've got three pawns so I may as well do that
moves.50... Kxe6 51. Ke4 Ke7 52. g4 Ke6 53. g5: He did his best to try and stop my pawn from promoting
moves.57. g7 Kd7 58. g8=Q Kc6 59. e6 Kd6 60. e:
And that's the end of the game.
After this game the teacher put me into the 12-13s tournament. Yay!
